question_stem: Using the student-mat.csv dataset from our lectures, conduct a χ2\chi^2-test of independence on the variables address and guardian at the 5% significance level.
question_stem_html: Using the student-mat.csv dataset from our lectures, conduct a χ2\chi^2-test of independence on the variables address and guardian at the 5% significance level.

items.part_stem: Using the student-mat.csv dataset from our lectures, conduct a χ2\chi^2-test of independence on the variables address and guardian at the 5% significance level.
items.part_stem_html: Using the student-mat.csv dataset from our lectures, conduct a χ2\chi^2-test of independence on the variables address and guardian at the 5% significance level.
items.solution_html:
To conduct a χ2-test of independence on the variables address and guardian using the student-mat.csv dataset, follow these steps:

  1. Load the dataset into your preferred statistical software (e.g., R, Python).
  2. Create a contingency table for the two categorical variables: address and guardian.
  3. Use the chi-squared test function available in your software to perform the test on the contingency table.
  4. Check the p-value from the test results. If the p-value is less than 0.05, reject the null hypothesis and conclude that there is a significant association between address and guardian. Otherwise, fail to reject the null hypothesis.

Make sure to report the test statistic, degrees of freedom, and p-value in your answer.
